alert.note: Alert for Allen; Noble; Southern Kosciusko; Wabash; Whitley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 2:10PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Allen, north central Wabash, southeastern Noble, Whitley and southeastern Kosciusko Counties through 245 PM EST... At 210 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Whitley, or 7 miles northeast of North Manchester, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Columbia City and Tri-lakes around 225 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Churubusco. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 308 and 309. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for north central Indiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 PM EST for north central and northeastern Indiana.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Noble; Southern Kosciusko; Wabash; Whitley
